intro: Lydaea, commonly known as the Lydaea plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant is native to various regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Europe, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Lydaea species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats. The leaves are often used in traditional herbal remedies due to their purported medicinal properties.
